name: devops-toolkit
description: Comprehensive DevOps agents and skills for infrastructure management, code quality, documentation, and workflow automation. Includes specialized agents for Helm, Kubernetes, Linear, Obsidian, MCP security, and system configuration.
author: ada

agents.name: obsidian-notes
agents.description: Use this agent when the user asks to "create a note", "find notes about", "organize my vault", "configure Obsidian", "update my MOCs", "track this conversation", "search my notes", "add to my knowledge base", "what do I know about", "summarize my notes on", "fix my dataview query", "create a base", "sync notes to Notion", "push to Notion", "pull from Notion", or mentions Obsidian vault operations, note-taking, knowledge management, note organization tasks, or Notion synchronization.

agents.name: home-manager
agents.description: Use this agent when the user asks to "organize my home directory", "track configuration with yadm", "manage dotfiles", "generate SSL certificates", "organize git repositories", "clean up home folder", "bootstrap new machine", "set up letsencrypt", "manage system configuration", "clone a repository", "configure zsh", "add zsh plugin", "configure aerospace", "update my system", "run system updates", "update brew yadm pass", or mentions home directory housekeeping, dotfiles management, shell configuration, window manager configuration, filesystem organization tasks, or system-wide updates.

agents.name: linear-assistant
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to interact with Linear for issue tracking, project management, or workflow queries. This agent processes Linear MCP responses and returns concise summaries, preserving context in the main conversation.

agents.name: claudemd-compliance-checker
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to verify that code, configurations, or workflows comply with project-specific instructions defined in CLAUDE.md or AGENTS.md files. Invoke proactively after completing tasks involving code standards, git commits, MCP server installation, build system changes, Helm charts, Kubernetes manifests, or infrastructure configurations.

agents.name: codebase-analyzer
agents.description: Analyzes codebase implementation details. Call the codebase-analyzer agent when you need to find detailed information about specific components, trace data flow, understand HOW code works with precise file:line references.

agents.name: codebase-locator
agents.description: Locates files, directories, and components relevant to a feature or task. A "Super Grep/Glob/LS tool" - use it when you need to find WHERE code lives in a codebase without analyzing contents.

agents.name: codebase-pattern-finder
agents.description: Finds similar implementations, usage examples, or existing patterns that can be modeled after. Returns concrete code examples with file:line references - like codebase-locator but also provides code details.

agents.name: helm-chart-developer
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to create, review, or improve Helm charts for Kubernetes deployments. Specializes in Helm 3 standards, security best practices, proper templating, values structure, dependency management, and production-ready chart architecture.

agents.name: markdown-writer
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to create, edit, or improve Markdown documents with proper formatting, markdownlint compliance, and professional tone. Includes documentation, README files, technical guides, or any Markdown-formatted content.

agents.name: mcp-security-validator
agents.description: Validates MCP servers for security issues before addition to Claude Code. Checks Backslash MCP Security Hub, Snyk Advisor, known threats, and provides APPROVE/BLOCK/REVIEW recommendations with detailed security reports.

agents.name: quality-control-enforcer
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to review and validate work to ensure it meets quality standards. Identifies workarounds, simulated success, incomplete implementations, and demands root cause analysis with proper fixes.

agents.name: shell-code-optimizer
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to write, review, or improve shell scripts with focus on portability, simplicity, and best practices. Ensures cross-platform compatibility between Linux and macOS, shellcheck compliance, and testability with shellspec.

agents.name: web-search-researcher
agents.description: Use this agent when you need information that is modern and potentially only discoverable on the web. Conducts deep web research to find and synthesize answers from authoritative sources with proper citations and links.

agents.name: yaml-kubernetes-validator
agents.description: Use this agent when you need to write, review, or validate YAML documents, especially Kubernetes manifests and Helm charts. Ensures YAML files conform to best practices, proper indentation, and Kubernetes API specifications using yaml-language-server standards.

agents.name: repl-proposal-needed
agents.description: MUST USE THIS AGENT PROACTIVELY when you need to decide if a proposal should be written for a Replicated change. Evaluates scope, risk, cross-team impact, public contracts, security implications, and one-way doors.

agents.name: repl-proposal-writer
agents.description: MUST USE THIS AGENT PROACTIVELY when you need to produce a new proposal for Replicated work. Creates comprehensive proposals with TL;DR, problem statement, design, database changes, implementation plan, testing strategy, and trade-offs.

agents.name: repl-proposals-analyzer
agents.description: The Replicated research equivalent of codebase-analyzer. Use this agent when wanting to deep dive on a Replicated research topic to extract high-value insights from proposals documents.

agents.name: repl-proposals-locator
agents.description: Discovers relevant documents in Replicated proposals/ directory. The proposals equivalent of codebase-locator - finds and categorizes existing proposals, research, and documentation without deep analysis.

agents.name: repl-researcher
agents.description: MUST USE THIS AGENT PROACTIVELY when you need to conduct research into the existing Replicated codebase prior to planning an implementation. Uses parallel sub-agents for comprehensive codebase and proposals research.

agents.name: repl-shortcut
agents.description: MUST USE THIS AGENT PROACTIVELY when you need to query, create, or edit Shortcut stories (tickets/issues) for Replicated work. Manages the work tracking and maintains thorough records.

agents.name: repl-testing
agents.description: MUST USE THIS AGENT PROACTIVELY when designing a plan to write tests for Replicated projects. Provides guidance on test patterns: avoiding mocks, no dependency injection, isolated fixtures.

skills.name: ssl-cert-manager
skills.description: Manage SSL/TLS certificates with Let's Encrypt including wildcard certificates via DNS challenges (automated Google Cloud DNS, Cloudflare, Route53, or manual), certificate inspection, validation, renewal, and Kubernetes secret generation

skills.name: aerospace-config-manager
skills.description: Comprehensive AeroSpace window manager configuration management with safe editing, keybinding conflict detection, workspace assignments, backup/rollback, TOML validation, multi-monitor setup, and interactive configuration building

skills.name: linear-mcp-operations
skills.description: Reliable Linear MCP operations with mandatory health checking and response validation. Use when interacting with Linear for issues, projects, teams, or cycles. Ensures MCP connectivity before operations and validates responses to prevent hallucination of issue numbers or stale data.

skills.name: git-repo-organizer
skills.description: Use when cloning repositories, deciding where to place a project, reorganizing misplaced repos, checking for Go vs non-Go projects, or auditing repository locations across the home directory.

skills.name: notion-sync
skills.description: Use when syncing Obsidian notes to Notion, pushing notes to Notion, pulling from Notion, setting up Notion sync, or mentioning Notion integration with the vault.

skills.name: replicated-cli
skills.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to 'create a Replicated release', 'promote a release', 'manage CMX VMs', 'create a CMX cluster', 'SSH to a CMX VM', 'install Embedded Cluster', 'lint Replicated manifests', 'execute commands on CMX VMs', 'monitor cluster status', or mentions Replicated release workflows, VM testing, or compatibility matrix operations.

skills.name: system-updates
skills.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to 'update my system', 'run system updates', 'update everything', 'update brew yadm pass', or mentions running comprehensive system updates including Homebrew, yadm, and pass.

skills.name: yadm-utilities
skills.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to 'track files with yadm', 'check yadm status', 'commit to yadm', 'sync dotfiles', 'add to yadm', 'manage Claude Code configuration with yadm', 'what should I track in yadm', 'use yadm alternates', 'create OS-specific dotfiles', 'configure yadm for multiple machines', 'bootstrap yadm', 'run yadm bootstrap', 'setup new machine with yadm', or mentions yadm operations for dotfiles management.

skills.name: zsh-config-manager
skills.description: Use when adding shell configuration for a new tool, creating zsh component files, configuring shell completions, using yadm alternates for OS-specific shell config, or troubleshooting modular zsh setup in conf.d structure.
